result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacy Lynn Ridgeway

records.addlTxt: NOH sent to Oneida County Jail with note from clerk, indicating she is to inform the JA of her status of incarceration. If still in custody at the date and time (11-16-22) she is to contact the JA, to see if zoom arrangements can be made with the facility.

10:40 AM Defendant Stacy Lynn Ridgeway not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court - clerk was made aware this morning that she was arrested last night and in Oneida County Jail, court will have set for another date and if still incarcerated to make arrangements for her to appear by zoom.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
De mother(Pam) called - she was arrested last night, she is now in Oneida Cty. mn

10:00 AM Defendant Stacy Lynn Ridgeway in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file, no attorney from SPD yet. Ridgeway makes comment, has asked her attorney in another matter in another county if he could represent her today and he stated that he would if SPD here would allow. Court instructs to contact SPD and inform them of that, he could then appear via Zoom, continues bond, set for AIA on 10/12/22 at 10:15 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Public Defender Status of Counsel Report
No contact with Mole Lake Casino Complex.

9:43 AM Defendant Stacy Lynn Ridgeway appeared by video, in custody from FC jail. Attorney Halyburton appears in person.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Defendant understands. Court questions if they have contacted an attorney. Defendant has contacted SPD and Attorney Halyburton was just appointed late yesterday afternoon - has not discussed the case with Ridgeway. Court will have set for AIA. Ridgeway has requested a reduction of bond. Court bond is currently $1000 cash. Ridgeway asks for signature bond. State objects to a signature bond for reasons as stated, but wouldn't object to reducing to $500 cash bond. Court will reduce bond to $500 cash bond, no contact with Mole Lake Casino Complex.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Prior: 4907 Aspen Street #8, Weston, WI 54476
